## Task Complete

**Task**: #3 — Scaffold Next.js 16 Frontend
**Status**: Completed

**What was done**:
- Initialized Next.js 16 in `src/frontend/` with App Router, TypeScript strict mode
- Tailwind CSS 4.1 with CG brand colors configured
- next-intl i18n with all keys migrated from `apps/locales/`
- Keycloak auth (next-auth v5 beta.25) with JWT role extraction
- RBAC utility with role hierarchy and module access matrix
- API client with auth headers, retry logic
- Zustand stores (auth + UI)
- TypeScript types for Employee, API responses
- Shared components: Header, Sidebar, MobileMenu (all role-filtered)
- UI components: Button (CVA), Card, Skeleton
- Home page with role-based quick action cards
- Vitest configured with 13 RBAC tests passing

**Verification**:
- `next build` compiled successfully
- `vitest run` — 13/13 tests pass

The background task notification is for the earlier `npm install` that ran in the background — it completed successfully (exit code 0). This was already handled; the dependencies were installed and everything is working. Task #3 is complete.

## Task Complete

**Task**: #11 — Implement Leave Management Frontend
**Status**: Completed

**What was done**:
- Created `use-leave.ts` hook with mock data for 8 leave types, 5 request entries, 15 Thai holidays, and substitute employees
- Created `leave-balance.tsx` — responsive card grid with progress bars, color-coded by remaining percentage
- Created `leave-request-form.tsx` — full form with real-time balance check and policy validation panel
- Created `leave-calendar.tsx` — monthly calendar with colored leave bars, Thai holidays, month navigation
- Created `leave-history.tsx` — filterable table with pagination, desktop + mobile layouts
- Created `leave-detail.tsx` — modal with status timeline
- Created 3 page routes: `/leave`, `/leave/request`, `/leave/history`
- Navigation was already integrated in sidebar and mobile menu

**Files created** (9 files):
- `src/frontend/src/hooks/use-leave.ts`
- `src/frontend/src/components/leave/leave-balance.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/components/leave/leave-request-form.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/components/leave/leave-calendar.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/components/leave/leave-history.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/components/leave/leave-detail.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/app/[locale]/leave/page.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/app/[locale]/leave/request/page.tsx`
- `src/frontend/src/app/[locale]/leave/history/page.tsx`

**Verification**: `npx tsc --noEmit` passed with zero errors

## Task Complete

**Task**: #26 — Implement Quick Approve & Manager Dashboard Frontend
**Status**: Completed

**What was done**:

### Quick Approve Hub
- Enhanced filter bar with search, date range, type filter badges with counts, urgency filter (urgent/normal/low)
- Urgency badges: red (urgent >3d), yellow (normal 1-3d), green (low <1d) with waiting-day indicators
- Sticky bulk action bar at bottom with max 50 selections
- Slide-over preview with approval timeline
- Confirmation modal (optional reason for approve, required for reject)
- Delegation management modal (create/revoke)
- Connected to real Quick Approve backend API with mock fallback

### Manager Dashboard
- Dismissible urgent alerts banner (critical alerts in red)
- Enhanced team summary cards (4 stats, pending links to Quick Approve)
- Pending approvals panel with top 5 + quick actions
- Expandable mini org chart with real API data
- Full monthly calendar with color-coded events and month navigation
- Team member grid/list view with profile navigation
- All connected to Manager Dashboard API with mock fallback

### Files created/changed:
- 2 API clients (`quick-approve-api.ts`, `manager-dashboard-api.ts`)
- 2 hooks enhanced (`use-quick-approve.ts`, `use-manager-dashboard.ts`)
- 2 page components enhanced (`quick-approve-page.tsx`, `manager-dashboard-page.tsx`)
- 11 new reusable components in `quick-approve/` and `manager-dashboard/`
- i18n: `quickApprove.*` added to EN + TH (filters, table, bulk bar, slide-over, detail, confirm, delegation)

**Verification**: TypeScript compilation passes (0 errors in my files)

The Next.js dev server is running. Open **http://localhost:3000** in your browser.

The root `/` returns 404 because the app uses locale-based routing (`/[locale]/`). Try:

- **http://localhost:3000/en** — English
- **http://localhost:3000/th** — Thai
The server is already running from the later command. It's live at **http://localhost:3000/en** — go check it out!
